mkv is a garbage format. if you are having trouble downloading it, you should probably upgrade your internet. I download 700 mb in like 15-20 mins. FXG, keep doing what you guys are doing.

MKV, much like AVI, is a container format. Simply being a "mkv" or "avi" file does not affect what size the movie is - how the movie has been encoded does that.

The advantage MKV has over AVI is that it supports unlimited audio, video and subtitle layers/tracks (making it great for DVD rips). It's not nearly as widely supported as AVI however, especially with hardware players.... slowly slowly catchy monkey!
